alert.note: Alert for Clark; Harrison (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 5:53PM EDT until May 26 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of EAST CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following counties, Bourbon, Clark, Fayette, Harrison and Nicholas. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 553 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Paris, Cynthiana, Carlisle, Millersburg, North Middletown, Blacks Crossroads, Jackstown, Hooktown, Headquarters and Little Rock. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
